intro: Bunium pestalozzae, commonly known as the Italian fennel, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs such as parsley and dill. The plant features a robust taproot and erect, hollow stems with finely divided leaves. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. The seeds are small, dry, and often used in culinary and medicinal applications.
